title: Three Subscription Services You Should Pay Double For
subtitle: Discover the top three subscription services that deliver incredible value and have transformed the way I approach fitness and nutrition. Find out why I'm happy to pay more for these services.
content:
Three Subscription Services You Should Pay Double For

Here are the three subscription services that I would gladly pay double for. And nope, I'm not being paid by any of these companies to say this. They're just that good.

Tyler, I'm a former financial advisor and portfolio manager, and now I make financial content for free so that you don't have to pay for it.

1. Peloton

I've tried every workout under the sun. Nothing keeps me as consistent as that app. The instructors are authentic, the convenience is game-changing, and the app caters perfectly to my being a raging introvert who is terrified simply of going to the post office to pick up my subscription for.

2. AG1

Yeah, it's an expensive drink, but I haven't been sick with a cold in two years. You know how long I've been drinking AG1? Two years. And you all see how much I walk outside in the middle of winter in Vermont. And it tastes amazing with just water.

3. CookUnity

I can cook my own breakfast and dinners, but lunch has always been my weak spot in the middle of a workday. Meal kits? Not in the middle of the day. Takeout? Too expensive. CookUnity? Just right. Delicious, never frozen, outstanding.

And if any of this is helpful, give me a high five on your next Peloton ride. Keep climbing 22. Find me riding with Matt Wilpers, Allie Love, or Hannah Frankson.
